metadata.Title: CVE-2019-11483 on Ubuntu 18.04 FIPS Certified (bionic) - medium.
metadata.Description:
Sander Bos discovered Apport mishandled crash dumps originating from containers. This could be used by a local attacker to generate a crash report for a privileged process that is readable by an unprivileged user.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2019-11483` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

apport - 2.20.9-0ubuntu7.8
apport-gtk - 2.20.9-0ubuntu7.8
apport-kde - 2.20.9-0ubuntu7.8
apport-noui - 2.20.9-0ubuntu7.8
apport-retrace - 2.20.9-0ubuntu7.8
apport-valgrind - 2.20.9-0ubuntu7.8
dh-apport - 2.20.9-0ubuntu7.8
python-apport - 2.20.9-0ubuntu7.8
python-problem-report - 2.20.9-0ubuntu7.8
python3-apport - 2.20.9-0ubuntu7.8
python3-problem-report - 2.20.9-0ubuntu7.8
No subscription required

criterions.comment: apport package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2.20.9-0ubuntu7.8').
